Recap: Lucy's attempt to seduce Ian brings out his fangs. He stops himself before it's too late, but Lucy is upset about her inability to help him. Ian always knew this day could come, which is why he has to move out. They say some tearful goodbyes before Ian finally walks out the door. Jamal blames Rafe for leaving the whole town to become bat food while bothering to save Alison and no one else. His assertion that he's happy to be a vampire shocks Alison, who reels when he bares his fangs and attacks her. Her screams bring Joshua and Frank back to the room, and they hold Jamal at bay. Joshua tells Alison that he's been turning her friends and relatives into vampires so that she will be surrounded by her loved ones once they're married. He summons two female vamps, who drag her to another location. At the catacombs, Rafe refuses to hand over the antidote until he finds out what happened to Alison. Although admitting that Joshua found out the truth because of her, Olivia refuses to actually take the blame, stating that this is Rafe's fault for holding back the antidote. Caleb offers to help get Alison back once he becomes a vampire again, but Rafe informs him that he's doing this alone. Olivia manages to take the vial out of Rafe's back pocket, but he knocks it out of her hand and stomps on it before leaving to rescue Alison. Caleb is furious with Olivia, who doesn't seem to have a clue as to the damage she's done. Rafe storms into the villa but finds that the furniture is covered and the property is no longer occupied. Joshua informs a horrified Alison that he has big plans for her.
Transcript: Lucy: Oh, I want you so much.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Rafe: I asked you a question, Livvie. Where's Alison?
Livvie: Sorry, I don't know. You've got the antidote?
Rafe: Yeah, that's right. It's right here.
Livvie: Well, give it to me.
Rafe: I was going to just hand it over to you till I took a headcount.
Caleb: Yeah, well, obviously Alison isn't here.
Rafe: And you, you were supposed to be making sure she was safe. That was the deal.
Caleb: That's right. Look, maybe she went for a walk, maybe she went looking for you. It's not the first time she did that.
Rafe: Uh-huh, and you're saying she just vanished, she just disappeared into thin air, right? That's your story?
Caleb: Ok. I'm going to go over this again for you because you're not getting it. I heard a noise. I went outside to see what it was.
Rafe: And then just -- poof -- like in a puff of smoke, she's just gone, right? you expect me to believe this?
Caleb: It's the truth, Rafe.
Rafe: Excuse me? What did you say? The truth? From you?
Caleb: Look, I don't like you, you don't like me, but I need that antidote. So it wouldn't be in my best interest to piss you off, would it?
Livvie's voice: She's alive.
Joshua: I beg your pardon?
Livvie: Alison Barrington. She's still alive and if you still want her, I know where she's hiding.
Rafe: You've already pissed me off, and you, you're not going to see a drop of this till you tell me what happened to Alison!
Caleb: Rafe, where would we have stashed her?
Livvie: Come on, back off, Rafe. Caleb knows nothing about this. He had nothing to do with it.
Rafe: Nothing to do with what?
Livvie: Alison leaving.
Rafe: Yeah? How would you know?
Livvie: I don't. I mean, Caleb had -- he wouldn't. He doesn't.
Rafe: Yeah, but you would, right?
Caleb: That is ridiculous.
Rafe: No, I don't think it is. I think it's the only thing that makes sense. You turned Alison over, didn't you? Huh? Livvie, tell me. Didn't you? Come on, tell me!
[SCENE_BREAK]
Alison: No. no, tell me this is all a big joke. You're not -- you're not one of them, not you.
Jamal: So you've been alive all this time, huh? Figures.
Alison: My God, how did this happen?

Jamal: Well, let's see -- I was at your memorial service and, if I recall correctly, I was a little bit upset, you know, about you dying and all. So I went for a little walk to calm myself down, and next thing you know I'm waking up on a slab, only I'm not really dead. so --
Joshua: This is very touching.
Alison: How could you do this? How could you do this to Jamal?
Joshua: I did this for you. This is your pre-wedding gift.
Alison: What?
Joshua: I thought it'd be good for you to have someone you trusted in our camp. It would make the transition to our lifestyle easier.
Alison: You are such a freak. You ruined Jamal's life just to get what you wanted?
Joshua: On the contrary. I made his life better, not to mention longer. Now, I'll leave you two alone and you can have a little chat.
Jamal: Ok.

Alison: Ok, listen to me, we're going to fight this, ok? We will. We can get through this. He thinks that Rafe can't find me, but he will. He's going to find us and he's going to rescue us, ok, I promise you.
Jamal: What makes you think that I want to be saved, spunky?
[SCENE_BREAK]
[Ian growls]
Ian: I'm sorry.
Lucy: You -- you wanted to bite me.
Ian: Yeah.
Lucy: I wanted to help you. I mean, I feel stronger. I was feeling better, so I thought maybe -- but this means my powers are gone. They don't work at all. They're gone, aren't they?
Ian: You just need to rest. You just need to rest. You get better, and you'll get better.
Lucy: No. We have to try something else.
Ian: Lucy --
Lucy: We could experiment or do some more research or something.
Ian: Stop. Please. We both know it's going to happen, that one day I'm going to lose control.
Lucy: You would never hurt me.
Ian: Hurt you? I almost took your life away.
Lucy: You didn't. You stopped in time.
Ian: This time, but I have this hunger inside of me and I can't --
Lucy: I know. I see it in your eyes.
Ian: No. It's always there. it's part of me now. I can't outrun it. I try to outthink it. I --
Lucy: You can, though. We have to try. We've come this far. We got over explosions and stupid Elizabeth and bad food in the cafeteria. We can get through this, too. We can. We have to try.
Ian: It's always there. It's who I am now and you're sick and you're vulnerable to a vampire's bite. You're in danger now.
Lucy: No. Not from you. Never from you. what are you doing? Where are you going?
Ian: I'm leaving. I can't be here with you. I'm moving out.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Caleb: Get your hands off her.
Rafe: She knows. Don't you, Livvie?
Caleb: I said leave her alone.
Rafe: Don't you?
Caleb: Leave her alone!
Livvie: Yes, you're right! Joshua found out Alison's alive because of me, but it was all your fault.
Rafe: Excuse me? It was my fault?
Livvie: You forced me to go to Joshua in the first place. If you would've just given me the antidote, nothing would have happened to Alison.
Rafe: I knew you hated her, but I didn't know you'd just turn her over like that!
Livvie: Look, I didn't mean to. Joshua tricked me.
Rafe: Hold on. First it's my fault, and now Joshua tricked you. I'm sorry, your story is sort of losing its course here.
Livvie: It's the truth. When I went to Joshua for the antidote, he saw how desperate I was.
Caleb: Is that the truth?
Livvie: Yes. He tricked me into admitting Alison was alive, but it wasn't my fault.
Rafe: No. no, that's right, nothing ever is. I got to get to Alison.
Caleb: How? Huh? Taking Joshua on, his whole army?
Rafe: If I have to.
Caleb: Then let me help you.
Rafe: Right, right, because you've been so much help already.
Caleb: Don't be an idiot, Rafe. just give me the antidote. Allow Olivia to restore me. I'll take Joshua on, and then you'll get Alison back.
Livvie: Rafe, Caleb's your only hope right now.
Rafe: I'll free Alison without your help and then I might take out a vampire or two just for fun.
Caleb: Hey. It's a suicide mission, man, and you know it.
Rafe: Get out of my way.
Livvie: Give Caleb the antidote, just like you planned. Don't punish Alison for my mistake.
Caleb: Help us. We'll help you.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Alison: What have they done to you? Why won't you let me help you?
Jamal: It looks like you're the one that needs some help.
Alison: No, I think we both need some help, so let's get out of here. Come on.
Jamal: Look, you're not listening again. I'm here because I want to be.
Alison: No, you don't. Jamal, don't give me that.
Jamal: I'm on the winning team right now, ok? And you will be, too, once you stop fighting it.
Alison: A winning team?
Jamal: Yeah.
Alison: You've got to be kid-- Joshua is a monster. You know that!
Jamal: Well, this monster is running things now.
Alison: I know that you're really upset with me, I know that you're angry with me for lying --
Jamal: Mm-hmm.
Alison: About being dead and all, but I had no choice. He wanted to make me his bride. I needed to disappear I'm so sorry.

Jamal: Yeah, right. You know, your slayer boyfriend was supposed to save the town with his slayer special skills and everything. At what point did he just decide to only rescue you and leave us rest to be bat food? hmm?
Alison: I'm sorry. I'm so sorry. This is all my fault.
Jamal: Hey, this is your old hood. It's gone straight to hell.
Alison: I know. I know.
Jamal: We kept fighting it and fighting it and fighting it over and over again, but seriously, what good did that ever do us, hmm?
Alison: Stop it. You're starting to sound like jack.
Jamal: Well, maybe Jack was right. Maybe you and I have been the fools all along.
Alison: Stop it. Listen to me -- I know that you are better than this.
Jamal: I'm listening.
Alison: I believe in you. You have good in your heart. I've always believed in you and I always will. I know that you would never spend all of eternity doing Joshua's dirty work.
Jamal: The Jamal you know is dead. But this one -- this one's ready to rock 'n' roll, baby! Hey, you know what, if you can't beat them, join them. You know what I'm saying?
Alison: Stop it. Stop it. I know you way better than this, and I know this is not in your heart.
Jamal: You sure about that, spunky?
[SCENE_BREAK]
Lucy: What are you doing? No no, I'm not going to let you just walk out of here and drive off into the night.
Ian: I'm leaving this house. I have to.
Lucy: We were going to talk about this. You have to at least stand there and talk to me.
Ian: Talk about what? Talk about what? I nearly turned you into the living dead, and it's only by the grace of God that I stopped myself.
Lucy: You stopped yourself. You -- you stopped yourself because you have control. You still have control.
Ian: No. I don't have control. I haven't for a long time.
Lucy: What? what?
Ian: It's not a sudden thing. it's been getting worse.
Lucy: You didn't tell me. you --

Ian: Not exactly dinner conversation, is it? You know, I -- I really thought that I was stronger than this. I really thought that I could fight this, that I could be the one vampire who didn't have to feed on anybody. I -- I would've done anything just to -- just to have one more day with you.
Lucy: It's not fair. I don't -- I -- I don't just let you go. I do not -- I don't accept this. That's -- no.
Ian: You can't wish it away, Lucy. That is why I asked Rafe to kill me. Because I don't want you watching me turn into a monster, some kind of --
Lucy: You're not, you're not. You're not -- not a monster. you will never be a monster. you are the man that I love.
Ian: And I love you. that's why I have to go.
Lucy: I can't --
Ian: I know.
Lucy: I can say something, right? Is there something I can say? There has to be.
Ian: It's funny, isn't it? I promised that I would take care of you always, and now the only way I can do that is by leaving you.
[SCENE_BREAK]
[Jamal hisses]
Alison: Jamal, please. Ow. You wouldn't do that to me. You wouldn't hurt me. We always used to have each others' back.
Jamal: Different time, different man.
Alison: Ah! Ah! Get off of me! Get off!
Joshua: I believe the friendly reunion has just turned ugly. Back off, Jamal! Back off! I'm so sorry, my dear. Sometimes our new recruits just cannot wait to try out their wings. Bad!
Frank: Ok, Jamal, we'll take it from here.
Joshua: Are you ok, my dear? I don't want one tiny little frown line to mar that beauty. I want you perfect for our wedding.
Alison: No, I would rather be dead, thanks.
Joshua: Well, you've already tried that, but, ah, that was a trick, wasn't it? Very clever. not a very flattering picture, though.
Alison: How did you find out? How?
Joshua: Even husbands are entitled to have their secrets.
Alison: Why are you doing this to me? Why? Why are you turning every single person that I love and care about into one of you? My nana and Jamal. I don't get it.
Joshua: Because I can. Because I want to. You are having a teensy-weensy case of jitters, aren't you? That's normal for a blushing bride. But very soon you'll get used to your new status.
Alison: I wouldn't hold your breath.
Joshua: And when you do, you'll be very grateful to me because you'll be surrounded by friends and family.
Alison: Oh, my God. I will never accept any of this.
Joshua: Oh, here we go again. You know, if Joshua had a dime for every time he hears that it'll be a cold day in hell, he'd be a very rich demon, indeed.
Frank: Fact is, Alison, becoming one of us is a privilege.
Alison: You may think it's a privilege, Frank, but I happen to like being a human being. I'm old-fashioned, I guess.
Joshua: Alison, you're on the verge of a brand-new world, one that's full of incredible sights and wonders, wonders that are beyond your wildest dreams.

Alison: You are such a freak. I swear to God, you're not taking me to Disneyland there, Joshua. I know what you want to do to me, and I'll have you know you may be able to turn me, but you will never have me.

Joshua: That's that fighting spirit that I love. It's so refreshing. I can't wait. Actually, I can wait, because I'm a very patient man, and, also, I have all the time in the world. I can wait for you for the rest of eternity. Ladies? please take my fiancee away and prepare her for paradise.
Alison: I can't even believe you. You can't do this to me. You can't do this to me. Ouch. Get off me. Jamal! Help me.
Jamal: What are you looking at me for?
[SCENE_BREAK]
Rafe: What are you doing? Huh? What, is this supposed to frighten me?
Livvie: Give us the antidote.
Rafe: Yeah, well maybe I'll think about that when I get Alison back, all right?
Caleb: Hey. He hasn't turned her.
Rafe: Really? How do you know that?
Caleb: I know Joshua. It's too ordinary. It's not his style.
Rafe: Oh, ok. well, thanks for the insight.
Caleb: No, you're not listening. I can help you, but not like this.
Rafe: Here's the deal -- from now on, I fly solo.
Livvie: Give it to me. Give it to me! Damn you, Rafe! Look at what you've done.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Ian: Let me have it.
Lucy: What?
Ian: That thing you're hiding behind your back looks a lot like my jacket.
Lucy:: I don't have anything behind my back.
Ian: It's not going to fit you, Lucy.
Lucy: I just thought, you know, if maybe you had something that you forgot that you had to come back for, then you would -- worth a try.
Ian: Yes, it was.
Lucy: Uh, so where you going to go? Are you going to go back to the loft? Of course. Just if I need to call you or get a hold of you in any way --
Ian: I'm going to put a call in to Ramsey and Karen. You know, they know your condition, and I've -- it's better this way. You know that.
Lucy: You keep saying that. I know that I'm supposed to try to get that through my thick head. It's just I'm having a lot of trouble getting it through to my heart.
Ian: So much I want to say to you. But I think you already know.

Lucy: What I know is I'm not going to get to see your face first thing in the morning and I know I won't get to hear your key coming in the door after it's been so long -- it seems like so long during the day when I haven't seen you the whole day, and I -- and I know I'm not going to get to hear that -- what is that you do in the shower? You know, you think you're singing. I don't know, it's weird.
Ian: Hey, let's --
Lucy: I also know that I'm not going to be able to just reach out and touch you like that whenever --
Lucy: Ian? I will always love you.
Ian: And I'll always love you more.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Livvie: It's all gone. It's all gone thanks to Rafe.
Caleb: Let it go. Let it go!
Livvie: This is all Rafe's fault!
Caleb: You're not exactly innocent.
Livvie: So what? I would do anything to help you, even if it meant turning Alison in to the devil himself.
Caleb: Rafe was wrong to hide the antidote from us.
Livvie: Caleb, he's had it all along. He's been stringing us along this whole time.
Caleb: You ruined everything by going to Joshua.
Livvie: I did it for us.
Caleb: I was handling this and you threw it all away because of your hatred for Alison.
Livvie: There you go again, defending sweet Ali.
Caleb: We're fighting for our lives here!
Livvie: Yeah, I know that.
Caleb: Do you? Because I don't think you have a clue to the damage you've done.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Rafe: Alison! Alison! I'm too late.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Alison: Stop it! Get off of me, runway freaks.
Joshua: Oh, there's that wonderful spirit. Perhaps not quite so endearing this time, but unique nonetheless. I hope you will like your new home.
Alison: I hope you die.
Joshua: Been there, done that.
Alison: You know, you're going to have to drag me down the aisle kicking and screaming.
Joshua: Oh, I must remember to find appropriate music. I understand this will be a little overwhelming for you at first, but I have no doubt you will get used to it.
Alison: Is this really what you want, Joshua? Do you really want a woman who is repulsed by you?
Joshua: Your resistance is temporary. But the love that we share, that will last forever.
Alison: I have that kind of love. I have that with Rafe.
Joshua: That was in the past. I have such big plans for you, Alison. Welcome. Welcome to your new home. Stay tuned for scenes from the next "Port Charles: Desire."
[NEXT_ON]
Livvie: You've changed. You're becoming one of them.
Joshua: Everything that I ever dreamed about is about to come true.
Rafe: You tell me where Joshua is now or I swear to God I'll kill all of you.
